overview:
Allison Atsiknoudas brings nearly two decades of proven performance in leading organizations to her role as co-founder and CEO of Investment Instruments Corporation. A registered architect, experienced entrepreneur and former United States Army Officer, Allison has a strong track record of developing and executing innovative solutions for one-of-a-kind challenges. Allison has extensive experience in successfully developing initiatives valued between $1M-$100M. She is a former director of a $1 billion dollar property portfolio for the U.S. Government in Europe. Prior to co-founding Investment Instruments, Allisonâ€™s specific areas of expertise included; architectural design, capitalization planning, portfolio management and the structuring of software systems used for building & portfolio management.

Allison holds a Bachelor of Architecture from the University of Miami and a Master of Science in Architecture Studies in Design and Computation from MIT. She has received numerous awards for leadership, operational innovation and business execution.
